p: One striking feature of early findings concerning KIV and WUV is their high rate of co-detection with other respiratory viruses. A co-detection rate of 74% has been observed for KIV and rates ranging from 68% to 79% for WUV [ 7]. So, even though an aetiological role in childhood respiratory disease has been proposed, it is difficult to assess a pathogenic role for these viruses unless observations are compared with those for matched control populations.
